formattedAddress: 35 W 8th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 35 W 8th St, New York, NY 10011, USA

editorialSummary.text: Creative craft cocktails & snacks in a petite brick-walled space with some banquette seats & stools.

originalText.text: Delicious cocktail bar, perfect to try unique mixes. This bar has a great vibe and is a fun spot for drinks throughout the night. I really enjoy trying different options. My favorite cocktail, from the menu the last time I visited, was the rosemary cocktail. Also the meat and cheese boards are pretty yummy.

text.text: Delicious cocktail bar, perfect to try unique mixes. This bar has a great vibe and is a fun spot for drinks throughout the night. I really enjoy trying different options. My favorite cocktail, from the menu the last time I visited, was the rosemary cocktail. Also the meat and cheese boards are pretty yummy.

originalText.text: Overall drinks and oysters were great. I showed up during happy hour and the hostess told me that the paper menu she handed me had the happy hour food and the bartender would tell me the happy hour drinks. Well the bartender did not. Which was fine but annoying because she set this precedent. Overall very impressed by the cocktails, nothing was overly sweet. Everything was well balanced, just underwhelmed by the service.

text.text: Overall drinks and oysters were great. I showed up during happy hour and the hostess told me that the paper menu she handed me had the happy hour food and the bartender would tell me the happy hour drinks. Well the bartender did not. Which was fine but annoying because she set this precedent. Overall very impressed by the cocktails, nothing was overly sweet. Everything was well balanced, just underwhelmed by the service.

originalText.text: Great atmosphere and vibe. Just pretentious enough. Cocktails are very unique and interesting. Appreciate the guide and flavor descriptions for all the drinks. They just changed the cocktail menu and were already out of two of them which was disappointing. Bartender warmed up as we talked to him and help guide our choices. My friend got “Rosemary” which based on the description we expected and wanted a more rosemary forward flavor. It was a solid drink but heavy on the gooseberry vinegar flavor. It was a little off putting at first but got better once it settled into the drink. I got the black sesame which I really enjoyed but still cannot describe the flavor profile it was so different. Definitely smoky, spicy and almost milky. Before we left our bartender made us a quick sample of a drink we wanted on the old menu “jalapeño” and it was strange and phenomenal. Definitely not somewhere I would spend a few hours but will be back for a quick pre or post dinner drink in the future.

text.text: Great atmosphere and vibe. Just pretentious enough. Cocktails are very unique and interesting. Appreciate the guide and flavor descriptions for all the drinks. They just changed the cocktail menu and were already out of two of them which was disappointing. Bartender warmed up as we talked to him and help guide our choices. It was a little off putting at first but got better once it settled into the drink. I got the black sesame which I really enjoyed but still cannot describe the flavor profile it was so different. Definitely smoky, spicy and almost milky. Before we left our bartender made us a quick sample of a drink we wanted on the old menu “jalapeño” and it was strange and phenomenal. Definitely not somewhere I would spend a few hours but will be back for a quick pre or post dinner drink in the future.

originalText.text:
Better known as a cocktail bar but the food is also fantastic. Cocktails are inventive and unexpected. The sesame, rosemary, and black truffle were faves.

The food menu was the unexpected winner of the night… French onion soup dumplings! Cassava fries! Duck poutine! All so so good!

We didn’t have reservations so we walked in and had a drink in the standing area. After about 15-20 mins there were seats available at the bar.

The food menu was the unexpected winner of the night… French onion soup dumplings! Cassava fries! Duck poutine! All so so good!

We didn’t have reservations so we walked in and had a drink in the standing area. After about 15-20 mins there were seats available at the bar.

originalText.text: The drinks were awesome. I would definitely recommend the mace and angelica. The bartenders are friendly and they know what they are doing. Drinks are on higher price range but worth spending on these drinks. A must try place if you’re in west village.
